segments.text: I watch the woman, so absorbed in her task, and a knot forms in my stomach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The overflowing sink is bad enough, steadily worsening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then there are the children, entirely too close to danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool beneath the boy is so clearly unstable; it wobbles noticeably.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost see it tipping backwards, sending him crashing to the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching so far, his balance is going to be compromised very soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And if he falls, he could bring the cookie jar down too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is already slick with water near the sink; anyone could slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of a child falling onto a wet, hard floor is truly unsettling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I fear for their safety, utterly unaware of the hazards surrounding them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a tense situation, waiting for the inevitable moment of crisis.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene makes me incredibly anxious for what's to come.
segments.speaker: PAR
